title: Drawing, "Ceres and Triptolemus", 1800–20
medium: Pen and brown ink over traces of graphite on cream laid paper
markings: Watermark: anchor in circle, below B
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Roundel design showing scheme for medal with agricultural trophy in lower part.  Ceres holds cornucopia and Triptolemus with lighted torch stand in chariot drawn by lions mounted at right. Woman and putti with trumpets, sheaves accompany them.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Ceres and Triptolemus", 1800–20.
1800–20. Pen and brown ink over traces of graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3313.
